sentence.Network_en: He is always having a little escapist fantasy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他总是抱有一丝逃避现实的幻想。

sentence.Network_en: The real escapist can watch a film and sip champagne on some services.
sentence.Network_cn: 真正会享受的人还可以在某些航班上看一场电影和喝香槟.

sentence.Network_en: The real escapist can watch a free film show and sip champagne on some services.
sentence.Network_cn: 在某些航线上,真正想逃避现实的人,可以看看免费电影,喝喝香槟.

This is an escapist therapy ., 这是逃避现实的疗法.

entry.tran: 逃避现实的；令人解脱的
entry.def: Escapist ideas, activities, or types of entertainment make people think about pleasant or unlikely things instead of the uninteresting or unpleasant aspects of their life.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who escapes into a world of fantasy

auth_sentence.content: But these escapist pleasures can encourage misleading conclusions about reality.
auth_sentence.res_content: But these escapist pleasures can encourage misleading conclusions about reality.

auth_sentence.content: He also makes no apology for feeding an escapist impulse.

auth_sentence.content: You can say the whole Internet has something very escapist to it.
